Signed me up for autorenewal which was more than twice what I have paid in the past. I immediately requested a cancellation and refund which they would not do. They say their 30 day cancellation policy doesn’t apply to renewals. Very underhanded and shady move. I’ve never had an auto-renewal refund request denied by a company. You can tell a lot about a company in how they deal with situations like this. Avoid.Edit: UK consumer law states that a cooling off period should be applied after an auto-renewal and the recommend 14 days. Nord are ignoring my UK rights despite saying on their website that local laws will lead to exemptions in policy.

Nord's VPN on my PC and phone were pretty reliable for the first year and a half or so.  Since then (past year and a half), it's constantly freezing (computer says "no internet connection"), causes my Ethernet and WiFi to become inaccessible (once the VPN has been turned off and the program quit, PC will then only reconnect to the internet after restarting), runs very slow (≈ 600+ Mbps slower than my internet speed), and other issues.  I've emailed customer support probably a dozen times, still no dice.  I AM NOT PAYING YOU TO ASSIST YOU WITH FIXING MY COMPUTER.  I can only imagine if I receive a reply here, they will tell me to 'gather more information' about my computer and 'contact customer support'.  This paid service can't run at all properly on my Windows 10 and up-to-date Android system.  I NEVER had theses problems with Express VPN.  Nord has lost another customer they have failed to support.  Had I received at least a discount for the hours of customer support-assistance I have provided them, I would not be so certain about ending things.  Nord is selling trash as gold.

Nord Vpn do auto renewal without you know unless you keep a close tab on your bank account.  Most of us use VPN when we travel overseas to secure access for our work releated softwares.  I opted for 30 days subscriptions where i was travelling for a week, because they dont have smaller pack.  Thats ok becasue i know what i am paying for. However the debit happens every month is a shocker and they say its on T&C.  My question is why cant you put that on the invoice you send "auto renewal after 7th day of everymonth" They dont.  It may be inbetween the 1000's of T&C wording for us to read and interpret.  This is the last thing on your mind when you travel. sneaky - Auto Subscriptions!

Review.Titre: Be careful is you buy it for 1 month
Review.Contenu: Be careful is you buy it for 1 month, they put an automatic AUTO-RENEWAL on your ONE MONTH SUBSCRIPTION. They catch you by putting in the terms and condition (which you don't take the time to read entirely obviously): "All our paid Services are provided on a Subscription basis. This means that the provision of the Services will auto-renew at the end of the current Subscription period, unless you cancel it before the auto-renewal."So if you needed to buy only one month, you need to make sure to take the auto-renewal off or else they charge you for the next month too and don't reimburse.

This year I get direct debited over 5x my normal purchase price. The same day of the deduction I Contacted them to see if I could do anything about it, keep the service just take of the NordPass because I don’t use it. They wouldn’t do anything. Told them I wanted to cancel the service and get a refund they refused. These guys used to be great, but now they’re just on a moneygrab, ignoring 6+ years of customer loyalty. Be careful of this mob! They’ll sting you!

Review.Titre: Felt and acted more like a virus
Review.Contenu: TL;DR: RUN AWAY! Do not use NordVPN!I got a deal for 2 years of this crime against computers. I thought it was weird at the time but too good to pass up. I was wrong. On the literal day of the money-back guarantee running out, everything started to go wrong. First, the speed dropped, then split tunneling, which is a key feature for me, stopped working altogether with some big popular apps.  I'm not a lazy user, if something goes wrong, I go hunting for a solution. While many people were experiencing the same problems I was. nothing was working for me. MY PC has gone through two installations and upgrades in those two years and NordVPN just refused to work properly with any of them.To make matters much, much worse, in the past year, major sites have started blocking NordVPN. I literally can't use it now. This was the last straw. I got a Black Friday deal on a different VPN and everything is working beautifully again. My hell is over and thus ends the two-year tyrannical reign of the literal worst thing I ever installed on any PC in 30+ years.STAY AWAY. NordVPN is a VIRUS at this point.
NordVPN is untrusted to me. Price changes a lot and other people get discounts. Sometimes huge 60-70% discount while others like me pay the full price.

Review.Titre: Refused a refund 5 minutes after being charged
Review.Contenu: Charged for the first month which is fair enough whilst I tried it out. I was away in Spain on a good internet connection and couldn't stream ITV without it stuttering every minute. Forgot to cancel and when they charged me for the second month I got in touch immediately within minutes of the charge to let them know it wasn't going to be used as it didn't work. They refused pretty bluntly saying that I've accepted the terms. Pretty terrible customer service given its payment upfront and hasn't actually been used. Just another company trying their best to make sure you forget to cancel after a trial just so they can charge you. No reminders or anything just charged and then refused a refund. Avoid.

Absolutely terrible. If I hadn't already paid for it and installed it on all my devices I would be demanding a refund and getting a different VPN. It completely took away the wifi option on my laptop and and customer service had to give me directions through an idiotic email chain.

Review.Titre: If you plan to use NordVPN in China
Review.Contenu: If you plan to use NordVPN in China, DON'T. It simply DOESN'T WORK.People who use VPN for jumping any internet restrictions in any country, don't count on NordVPN. You're wasting your hard earned money.No "customer service" or "troubleshooting" offered by NordVPN make it usable for MONTHS. Can you imagine paying for a service and it doesn't work since day 1 for months?

Review.Titre: It slows down my internet speed
Review.Contenu: Sometimes when I connect through NordVPN my internet connection speed goes down very badly. I tried to navigate the Help section for a live chat link or email address without success. The problem is that I subscribed for a two year plan, and the 30 day money back window is over. I'm very disappointed.

I purchased a 2-year service, but the company charged me 2-year service fees twice. I applied for a refund (ID #14855902), but it was not approved by the company, but I was sure it was a system error and I did not purchase two two-year services at the same time. After communications, I still haven't received a refund from the company, and the company hasn't taken this issue seriously.

Nordvpn casuing my internet connection to go from 320mb down to 26mb down. Un-installed , re-installed software, same thing. change to special DNS , same thing, want me to reset/clear cache on wifi devices and it "may " fix the problem. Lousy product, lousy support/tools. Filing a BBB complaint

Review.Titre: I subscribed to Nord and also…
Review.Contenu: I subscribed to Nord and also subscribed with incogni, however I did not receive the link to start my incogni subscription.  After speaking the Nord. bot, which refused to understand my question i sant 2 emails to incogni last week and still waiting for a reply,  i would like a refund for the incogni subscription, given they have no support function i dont want to use their app.

Review.Titre: Never use NordVPN for China travel! WARNING
Review.Contenu: Tried to use NordVPN for a one-month China trip, because it was recommended on many blogs. However, not only did they not refund me but charged me a second month for their services. They said I need to cancel my subscription before 30 days. How can I cancel my subscription if your VPN doesn't work and I'm in China without access to your website?

Review.Titre: The vpn doesn't work at all
Review.Contenu: The vpn doesn't work at all. They promise to refund but apparently only for initial purchase. Don't try it, you'll not use it enough as the VPN doesn't work extensively, like the asian VPNs won't work at all, and the American vpn isn't useful really. Waste of money.

No follow up or response from support team for requested help or assistance.  Only redundant form letters saying that your request has been noted and that a member of the team will contact you via email.  In the past four days I've received no meaningful response, only automated form letters promising assistance.  NORD_VPN support is easily the worst I've yet encountered from a paid subscription service provider.

Review.Titre: Speed is wretchedly slow with the VPN…
Review.Contenu: Speed is wretchedly slow with the VPN on regardless of protocol or by disabling any other setting. To make its performance even more embarrassing, the ethernet cord is plugged directly into the computer. Of course, wifi on another computer is much worse. Pages on both load like 90's dialup modems. Even online videos are a challenge to stream. It should be noted I have among the highest bandwidth one can buy. I've had Nord since March 31, 2023.

Customer Service is absolutely appalling, if you ever want anything resolving with your account be prepared to try and jump through hoops for weeks. You will be better off going with their competition.

Does not work in China. Messed up my computer and it never worked on my phone. Tried to get refund however they refused. Watch out for this company and stay far away.   Could not access the Nord site and unable to rectify. My associate also purchased Nord and we both had to remove from our PC and phone. All apps were downloaded and tried just before leaving Canada. Still not working. maybe tech savy people can resolve this issue but not all users are that experienced. I am not in a restricted country and returned back to Canada to see 2 charges on my credit card.

They don't seem to understand identity verification. All I wanted to do was change my email address, but their identity verification is broken. They confirm you own the account by getting you to ask another company to send you the correct pdf. I don't know why they trust a 3rd party to confirm your email address more than confirming it themselves.If they don't understand that email verification, I worry what else they don't understand about IT security.

I go through NordVPN setup routines.  Seems to be successful, then I manually launch it.  However when I do a restart, I must go through setup all over again.  Very difficult to use.  Would not buy it again

I thought I had cancelled my subscription years ago.  Apparently they've charged me hundreds of dollars over the years of disuse.  After a year of no usage it is unethical to continue service, charging someone for nothing.When I caught this, and asked for a single year refunded from 34 days ago, they refused as it was outside my 30 days.

This is terrible.Unfortunately I signed up for a two year deal. When this is over i will try someone else.

Often have to sign in again at startup and if the kill switch was on from last session then this takes a looooong time. I turn off the kill switch before shutting down ... still locks me out at next power up. Slow traffic sometimes down to 5 mb/s. Stops traffic for some unknown reason . I perform all the trouble shooting network steps and still does not come back online. Perform a restart and still locked out. Date of experience ... too often. Awful customer service, no passion or understanding of a given situation.I would avoid this company at all costs!!Elaine and Reed on live chat pretend to understand and help you but really all they do is use delay tactics to make it seem that they are looking into helping you. Review.Contenu: Crashes ever time I try to reconnect to a server.Have changed to another VPN and I cannot recommend this VPN.

I was led to believe I was using a free trial but I only realised it was the beginning of an auto-renewing subscription when I saw a debit from my account. I appreciate that the fine print make this all legal but it was certainly engineered by NordVPN to trick me into allowing a subscription payment I was fully aware of. NordVPN rejected my request for a refund of the of the subscription for the forthcoming month of their service which I had no intention of using having deleted the app. Be careful if you just want to trial this product.

Review.Titre: NordVPN is NOT a reliable product
Review.Contenu: NordVPN is NOT a reliable product!  They have not helped resolve issues with the software!!!  And then when I finally gave up and had to remove the software so my computer and phone would function, the company refuses to refund the purchase price!!!NordVPN is horrible! Dishonest company that cannot provide the service it promises. No connection in china or other countries with restrictions. No refunds even if service is completely down for months or years. Once they have your money they simply do not care. AVOID

Review.Titre: I’d give zero stars if I could to these…
Review.Contenu: I’d give zero stars if I could to these shiesters. I live in Australia, they are advertising to me as an Australian user. They advertise deals to me stating for example product x for $35. I proceed to checkout and it says A$35, so I assume I’m getting charged $35 Australian dollars, but as soon as I hit checkout it says thanks for your $50. I complain, and NordVPN have the audacity to tell me that it is obviously meant to mean A for American dollars not A for Australian dollars. Which other website uses A for American dollars instead of USD? Never giving them my money again, and as far as I’m concerned, they should never be allowed to sell their products in Australia with those shonky tactics.

Leaving. It was perfect before the last couple of months or so. It is now too annoying. Unable to connect to the VPN. Last 2-3 weeks kept installing and uninstalling so could keep going. Even Killswitch is turned off, unable to reach the internet. It is messed up. Customer service is those long email conversations—no instant support. Issues being abroad in Egypt. There was no service. Their support person emailed the "solution", which was pretty much for IT specialists and not for ordinary folk. To make some fun of it, thanks for not asking to create a program code.

Review.Titre: Turn it off to access most streaming sites
Review.Contenu: I’m sure it works because most of the websites I go on (Netflix, streaming sites) block me when my VPN is on.. I have to turn it off almost every time I’m on Netflix or other sites.. I’m not sure if I’ll renew my VPN subscription with this company if it continues to be difficult..

Review.Titre: I subscribed so that I can watch soccer…
Review.Contenu: I subscribed so that I can watch soccer matches on Fubo TV and DAZN outside of my country (Canada). But it appears those apps have blocked VPN's or somehow are able to know that I'm outside of Canada preventing me from watching the games. Very disappointing. If there is a way around this without having to pay more money, that would be greatly appreciated.

Review.Titre: Very annoying to get the refund within…
Review.Contenu: Very annoying to get the refund within the 30-day period! The service worked fine but I ended up not needing it as much as I thought so tried to cancel within thirty days. ONE ad a week would be MORE than enough while ONE ad per 2 weeks would suffice.  Please get this message to them on my behalf as they're deaf to customers preferences.  Thank you.

Don't do port forwarding. No seeding on private torrent

The first time I wasn’t even noticing there was something different with my devices (it’s a good thing as everything was working seamlessly) This time there’s much more issues. Every now and again the vpn blocks my internet. Neither online apps nor internet pages load. Putting the VPN on pause stops the issues and everything works fine again.. I contacted the support about it, was told to change the protocol used. It worked. Only for a short period and then I’d have to switch again or put it on pause..
Good Service, but begging for review via Email.

Review.Titre: VPNs are on the way out
Review.Contenu: As companies have updated their internet tracking, this service has become less and less valuable. VPN services seem to be on the way out (for valid reasons such as elimination of fraud activities). Most of the benefits I could receive from a VPN get eliminated by the inability to use  VPN for the protection I'd like to. I.e. my bank doesn't like when I access via a VPN because I might be some foreign actor using a VPN service to skirt the law, but really I need to pay a bill and I'm on airport WiFi for instance.

Then the whole point is lost.

Review.Titre: The main issue is that it keeps…
Review.Contenu: The main issue is that it keeps disconnecting itself, despite being set to 'always on' usually after my phone goes out of WiFi range. It then refuses to acknowledge my correct sign-in password so I have to repeatedly get a one time password to reactivate it. The risk is that this isn't always apparent when using the web for banking etc unless I check each time. Not impressed so far.

Review.Titre: Less than stellar billing and customer service
Review.Contenu: I have not had issues with Nord VPN but your billing and customer service could only be described 'as less than stellar'.  Last year my subscription was auto renewed even though there was more than a year left on my account. Unnecessary aggravation to get the charge reversed.This year I took advantage of their 'Cyber Monday' special on the Nord VPN website.  After renewing, my account didn't reflect the extra 3 months.  To add further insult I then wasted over half an hour in a chat session and was offered a different plan which would have charged me even more.  Unnecessary aggravation and never I get the offer on their website.
Windows application is unstable, breaking connection, not launching properly each time, continuous troubles.The VPN service alone is decent, once the app works.

Insufficient bandwidth on UK service. My reply to your reply. You claim you do not limit bandwidth. My understanding is you pay for the bandwidth in the UK on a Server, jam as many users as possible to make larger profit.

Review.Titre: Altho the internet ive go is Dire…
Review.Contenu: Altho the internet ive go is Dire (smarty)i purchased NOrdvpn to try and get over the Incessant throttling that smarty reckon they dont do especially on P2P clients. This VPN seems to take a long time to initialise and torrenting on NordLynx is a waste of time.at the moment changing to OpenVPN2 udp seems to help (but for how long) But for some reason that Protocol disables Internet on LAN Adapter ,and you end up with badly connecting(if at all) websites . The Way i have got round this is by disabling LAN and plugging in a WiFi adapter wich allows internet connection again . this is a weird carry on . Qbitorrent is set up to  access ethernet4 as it should be etc . All in all not the best of experiences . If i were a Noob i would have been well stuck

You too will one day experience your brain diminishing from old age. It hurts.

Review.Titre: I saw so much good promotion online…
Review.Contenu: I saw so much good promotion online about NordVpn. They are supposed to have 24/7 customer service. But I could not get their service to work, I would be booted offline every 5 minutes. Customer service emails took 24-48 hours to come, and they would address *one way to solve the problem at a time. This means weeks of troubleshooting with multiple customer service representatives losing the threads and contradicting each other. I was told you can only watch Amazon Prime in the location where your billing address is (not true in my experience traveling without VPN). The AppleTV app connected to their server(s) but would cut off every few minutes. Just a waste for me, unfortunately. They did refund my money bc they have a 30-day money back guarantee.Edit: NordVPN responded to this review within a few hours—way faster than any response by their tech support. I did try to use their chat help, it is a bot that glitches and kept repeating the same unhelpful thing, no way out of that loop.

Review.Titre: Connects to UK servers, not Ireland
Review.Contenu: Seems to do its job.  However, I am in Ireland and NORD seems to connect to uk based server although it says connected to ireland.  I am tired of having to constantly switch servers to access Irish webpages.  For this reason I will seek an alernative.

Review.Titre: lackluster, but is still a vpn so…
Review.Contenu: While it have gained some value out of using the services, it has been a disappointment overall. Like many I am sure, after a trusted YouTuber shilled for Nord, I signed up. It hasn’t been all bad, hence the two stars, but I have used a few other vpn services over the years and this one is dead last in my recommendation list.

Review.Titre: Be prepared for everything to take longer.
Review.Contenu: I turn NordVPN off about 50 times a day doing everyday tasks. If a website doesn’t load, it’s because of NordVPN. It’s incredibly frustrating.

Review.Contenu: Definitely not as good as hide.me, only switched because hide.me no longer supports Windows 7. Most of the time VPN connections fail, no matter where you try. Sometimes VPN connections stop for no reason.

It freezes my macbook with an M1 chip. Apple advised me to reduce the number of open applications, but the problem continues.3. Often when I connect from Paris to another country it does not connect. I have to restart the vpn.

I recently tried using the service but for some strange reason my connection was really struggling to have a decent speed. I used it to get access to some region locked video services but I had buffering every 10 min this on a 200 mbps line at home. I tested a free vpn and I had better connection.

Review.Titre: Was a loyal customer for almost 3 years…

Not the customer support rep's fault - more so the fault of the overall company. I've canceled my auto-renew subscription and have moved to a different provider for all my services.

Review.Titre: Had this for over a year and use for…

I have been trying to get my HBO Max work in a different country but I haven’t been successful. I had better experience with SurfShark or whatever they were called. Even the two city VPN.

This website holds the title for the worst user experience ever. So hard to find anything, no log-in buttons for existing users. No download buttons for the apps. I want to renew my old subscription, instead of taking my money and moving on I get directed to a page that tells me to download the app on my phone and pc to proceed. Review.Titre: Constant updates. Extension crashes in Linux browsers (Firefox & Brave)
Review.Contenu: Too many updates. Almost weekly. Browser extension in Linux (Firefox and Brave) crashes constantly, and will not log on again, which means it has to be uninstalled and then re-installed almost every day. Other than that, when it works, it's fine I guess.

Took the annual subscription in order to use the SmartDNS on an Apple TV.  Worked well day one, but then wouldn't connect to the internet on day two and thereafter. The issue I have is with the tech support.  In short they were useless. Really slow to reply and kept giving me the same instructions, or advice that wasn't relevant to the issue.  Not impressed, so I've cancelled the service and looking at other providers.

Review.Titre: I love the product but support 24/7 ?
Review.Contenu: I love the product, I have been using it for more than 5 years, always fine. But when I purchased a new TV box from China, it was a struggle to install the Nord app on the Android system. Support at Nord was erratic. 3 different support agents suggested 3 different ways to install it and finally, the 4th version worked. The often repeated affirmation that service is 24/7 was quickly disproved  as it took 24 hours for each email reply. And each time a different agent who did not seem to have read the entire ticket and mechanically suggested yet another way to proceed. At least it did not take 7 days to resolve !

I have been a customer of Nord for several years and it has worked well during that time. However, it stopped working whilst on holiday in Turkey. I exchanged a great number of messages with the customer support team and they did try (unsuccessfully) to help. On my return to the UK the apps started working again without a problem. I repeatedly suggested that NordVPN have an issue in Turkey but there was a distinct lack of enthusiasm to take this on board. So unfortunately I have to give a poor review because they don't want to own the problem.

NordVPN is scamming customers, I discovered by chance that I have been charged TWICE on my bank statement. The problem is that NordVPN REFUSED to pay back the extra-charge arguing that I have opened two accounts!! When? I have been using one email and one password....if I had two accounts, I should have TWO emails and password!! Avoid this scammers !!!Response after....your replyThanks for the response and refund, but I moved to 2 stars the experience, but you CAN´T INVENT excuses like I HAD two accounts.

The Nord system has resulted in my internet connection being lost and I understand this is a common issue and my lack of computer skills mean I am unable to resolve itYesterday, the system would not work at all and I resorted to asking Nord for help. No reply yet Regret buying long term subscription to this product

Summary: Faulty engineering, great marketing, sleazy sales-tactics (you won't get your money back, no matter what they promise)NordVPN have great marketing, their name suggesting reliable, German-like engineering. Unfortunately, this hasn't been the case when I used their software. So I lost money - not once, but twice. I am afraid I am too trustworthy and I keep falling for the positive reviews (even though I just noticed that the ones here read like ads).The first time, a few years ago, I asked them if their service worked in China, which they confirmed before I bought a 2 year plan. When I arrived, it didn't work. Nord support then do what they do - they send you on a wild goose-chase, trying to grind you out of your demand for a refund: 'try this, now try that'. They are relentless and in the end I gave up the money to keep my sanity.Because I'm naive, I tried again recently and - surprise! - same story. This time I only bought a monthly plan, though. Again, software didn't work, 'support' does their "before we refund we want to trouble-shoot" which they keep up until ultimo. My advice: Don't. Just don't.

Luckily PayPal stepped in to cancel the transaction.Just be careful guys there must be some clause in the terms and conditions ( that nobody reads) subscribing you to this extra service.Will be looking around for another supplier as I can’t trust them now after such sharp practice.And yes I have reached out to support and suppled a ticket number but no explanation was forthcoming just a curt warning that my service would be suspended.

I find that this VPN tends to have trouble with i players in particular BBC, not sure if it's Nord or me , but it's frustrating. The password  app is also temperamental, at the moment it won't autofill.

Review.Titre: Times out  or shuts down at any…
Review.Contenu: Times out  or shuts down at any time..always in the midst of something important.... this happens daily.no way to talk to someone...only communication is thru e mail

Does what is says, but the startup is very slow in comparison to Proton VPN.  Get an excessive amount of banners that don't want to just go away, so they block things like the sound or connection access.  Even with preferences set, it still sometimes connects to the country I'm in at the time as opposed to the country I set it for.  On my cellphone, it often slows up the opening of websites and I have to reset the VPN.  This doesn't happen if I change to Proton.  Nord is good and I'll keep it until near renewal, at which time I'll do some shopping around.  I have read that Express VPN is also pretty good.

Good vpn, but it reduces my uploadspeed. If the VPN is sett to "pause" it will still reduce my upload. I need to kill the application before everything return to normal.  My original connection is 300/300. On my VPN its 250-300/50.

Doesn’t always auto connect to servers. Also doesn’t connect to certain servers I.e.Banking (BofA, Fidelity, Chase), Amazon via iPhone and iPad. Does a good job with hiding your IP address however many streaming services won’t allow you to connect with it.

Review.Titre: I have to disconnect for banking
Review.Contenu: I have to disconnect for banking. When I researched using a VPN I read that it would only slow any connection slightly, this proved to be untrue as my direct link to my bank is impossible whilst still using the VPN.Thankfully the connection to the UK while I am on holiday is still OK. Think carefully if you don't want the inconvenience of disconnecting when you want to see your bank balance.

A great service, and value for money, only problem is it keeps dropping out, very rare can watch an entire episode or movie without it stopping, that wonderful doughnut of death, circling like a vulture will it or will it not start up again.

Mostly works as it should. Some connections break. email client and some web sites not connecting.Cant reply to the comment so will do it here. Been in contact with customer support. been through all of there suggested fixes with no success. Still no connection when trying to check email through em client and patchy connections when using chrome, not as bad on firefox. Works great on my nvidia sheild, probably should give it another star for that!I dont know why the vpn dosnt allow me to connect to some of the sites I use every day but my expectation is that nord supply me with an app that just works and I dont have to spend a lot of time tinkering with it or waiting for replies from tech support. My only successful fix to date is to pause the vpn connection when i want to check mail and allowing chrome to use the app tunnel feature which kind of defeats the purpose of having it on in the first place. Keep the updates coming , maybe it will fix the issue.

VPN works, but blocks internet access on several apps on my iPhone as well as iPad. In order to access the internet, I have to temporarily disable the VPN. When contacting support, they want me to make changes to my router, which I won’t do. Additionally, they can only be contacted through email adding to time the VPN is down. Date of experience is ongoing since purchase. I am not technologically proficient. So, buyer beware.

I have used Nord VPN for four years and it works well. When there are issues, customer service responds quickly. I initially tried it for a year then got a very good deal for a three-year package. Now there are reductions in price for new members but those of us who have used the product for years pay full fare. I did learn that I could discontinue my service then reapply and get a price reduction, however it's not a way to treat loyal customers.

Rather clunky - takes too long to start up, sometimes VPN  goes to UK, sometime Spain. Worst of all, using hotel WiFi systems is impossible. I have to remove the software.  Obviously there must be some reason why this happens. But NordVPN is made by clever people - but it is a bit of a pain for ordinary people.

I’ve had the software installed for nearly a year. The form for this review asks for a specific date of my experience. As my experiences have been consistent over a year, I merely chose the beginning of the month.The software works okay on my Mac. On my Mac it works consistently with only some connectivity interruptions that can be solved by stopping and starting network. I also have several of the Nord suite of apps installed. Nord Pass works best and is the consistent. All portions of the suite work better on my Mac than they do on my iphone.The VPN on my iphone is nearly unusable with home automation apps as well as any bank or health app.  Productivity apps such as email, calendar, and mapping work fine most of the time. Social media apps also work fine most of the time. For me problems with any app or connection to the internet can be solved by stopping Nord VPN for a time. In the worst of cases stopping and starting WiFi or a phone restart is needed.

Review.Titre: Pretty Good except for some websites
Review.Contenu: I've been using Nord VPN for a couple years now. I think it works and is reasonably priced. the User interface it fairly straightforward to navigate. The only concern I have is that several websites don't work with NordVPN, so I have to pause my connection for 5 minutes and reload the website page, which defeats the purpose of having a VPN service.

"When it's working" it's great. Fast, seamless, easy.The emphasis working is that now, on a seemingly near daily basis it stops, then fails to connect and find servers without toggling settings several times. There's been points where I've had to shut it down entirely just to have web access. Not great for something that's supposed to protect your web access. It's an issue that's seemingly getting worse over time.

Review.Titre: Cities were listed not just countries
Review.Contenu: Cities were listed not just countries ok, so when I put on VPN, I used to be able to type in Vancouver and it would say Vancouver Canada now when I do it it just says Canada.

Very slow in start.Sometimes need change  server two times to see BBC . ITV and chanell 4 okIt happens time to time. need to drive incognito. RTL 2 Luxemburg does dot work  at all.Austria ServusTV with problems too.Good in nordic channels. I`m fan to Formula 1 and MotoGP so Servus and Luxemburg important to me

I liked NordVPN few yeara ago and i am customer for more then 4 years but it doesn't work like it did before. To explain completely i travel a lot and some apps and streams i can watch only if im in my home country. Previously i used NordVPN and it worked perfectly by coosing my home country server to watch streams i used to watch. Now days thats not possible and somehow all apps can recognize im not at my original location. Tried everything to fix that but i wouldn't help. Because of that reason i went from fully satisfied customer fully disappointed.

Review.Titre: Needed som negotiation to keep the service reasonably priced
Review.Contenu: I love the product, but i was miffed i have to say i was going to let it lapse and move to another VPN 🥲 after that i was given the same price as a newcomer would receive. It’s disappointing when companies auto roll you over and the new price when they are willing to reduce if you threaten to move providers. The App is brilliant so I’m glad I was able to get the preferential deal😜!

Review.Titre: While I like the whole idea, I don’t feel totally protected.
Review.Contenu: While I like the whole idea of not be able to be tracked and the attempts to be hacked, I find that there are more and more websites and streaming services that will bar you from visiting and signing up or, logging in and, require you to turn off your VPN to enter their website.  Is this being worked on?  Is there a workaround?

Review.Titre: I would say I’m quite satisfied, But one big problem
Review.Contenu: I would say I’m quite satisfied, but for many months now the problem persists that often websites do not open or servers are not found because of vpn. Then I have to change the country or pause NordVPN. That problem should be fixed and I contacted more than once the customer care, but nothing happened…
Not so reliable. Sometimes the servers are either with poor out connection or not connecting at all, so I have to turn off NordVPN.
Slows start up, I have to disconnect when I use my scanner as it doesn't show computer connected, constantly connecting and disconnecting.

Review.Titre: Softare crashes a couple of times per…
Review.Contenu: Softare crashes a couple of times per week MANY websites does not open when vpn is active.Have become insanely slow to a degree it has to be turned off paused to be able to browse Internet

Review.Titre: Sometimes i get the objective, sometimes i dont
Review.Contenu: Sometimes i get the objective: to be free of sites limitations; sometimes i dont. Also, sometimes the VPN resource is detected and the site in unavailable for some reason, but if Nord VPN is paused, the site becomes immediatly available, with no excuse (v. g. Helloreal.com).. So, Nord VPN is not 100% efective.
I had multiple occasions where my internet stopped working. Each time disconnecting Nord VPN resolved the issue immediately. This happened so often that I have stopped using the VPN

Review.Titre: When using the vpn on my firestick it…
Review.Contenu: When using the vpn on my firestick it disconnects often and at times makes it difficult to watch IPTV.While on my pc well I have no complaints at all,it works very well.

Sometimes it’s really difficult to connect. Pressing on a ip address and it takes some time to connect, the app freezes on the computer and the connection is not really stable on some servers. I’m happy with the rest!

Review.Titre: Easy to use; Autoconnect features degrading
Review.Contenu: The app is easy to use and install on multiple devices.  I use it on IOS, Android, and a Windows PC.  Although I have been a customer for over two years, recently there have been issues with autoconnect on most devices when I move from WiFi to Cellular or just wake my PC.  I created support tickets with NordVPN, and they responded in a reasonable time.  The recommended solution has helped, but I still have issues more now than in the past.

Just build a Linux app already.  Performance reports would be nice too.   How about a real-time heat map of traffic to avoid.   Come on folks.   Do something crazy good for the group.  About average performance to date.  Nothing jaw dropping to note.   Thanks

Review.Titre: Did not work well on my Linux machine
Review.Contenu: Having a Linux machine (Ubuntu 18.04) it is really problematic to make NordVPN work, because you are terminal-bound and completely on your own. In my case, the latest version didn't work, and I needed to research and install an older one. But NordVPN doesn't work after a suspend. You actually need to restart the machine every time to be able to use it.I requested a refund during the trial period but it was not honored. The direct communication with NordVPN is not easy, since they manage their subscription through a third party, Paddle, and it ends up acting as a communication barrier between the customer and NordVPN.In justice to the product, though, once you are connected the VPN service is quite good.UPDATE: When I proved that I requested a refund on time, NordVPN refunded me the 3 months of service charged. I am upping their rate on these grounds.

Review.Titre: Probably the best VPN out there but...
Review.Contenu: Probably the best VPN out there but the support is not that great and the client can log you out at random on macOS. Something their support are not able to help you with. They throw bad solutions at you that does more harm to your system than good and it doesn't work. They still deserve 3 stars however, there are many servers to choose from and I love the pause feature. The speciality servers are also really good

I have reported failed connections of my Blink camera system, a couple of times, depending on  which server was connected. Some servers allow successful operation of my camera system, others don't.Each time tech support suggested it was either my wi-fi, or the Blink system. How? when it works on some servers but not others.

Review.Titre: Bit more laggy than I had hoped
Review.Contenu: VPN wise, ok. I do notice a slowdown in data speed. Does not matter if I choose a local server or a server far away. Becomes slow enough that it hinders my YouTube watching, Netflix or other streaming service. When I turn off the VPN it's definitely back to what I'm used to. So for most things good enough, but some times a little more patience is required

I’m not sure what was expecting but I thought a vpn would protect and hide my ip address , I still get block as on sites as they aren’t in my area, thought that would stop. Not sure what I getting for my money. Also I have keep connecting as it will say I’m not protected. I’m somewhat confused as to value

After booting the system, I usually have to wait 1-2 minutes before the VPN is up. Periodically, the VPN encounters an error (Oh Snap) and has to restart. The vpn has to be manually restarted after some Windows updates. Some sites will not accept connections from a VPN; so what is the point of using a vpn if you have to suspend the vpn to connect to a site.

Review.Titre: I use Linux and and my preferred…
Review.Contenu: I use Linux and and my preferred distribution is Manjaro. Nordvpn was working fine with Manjaro until very recently then it was dropped and this has forced me to fall back on Mint Linux, this is OK but forced me to do a lot of file transferring. Please NordVPN bring back Manjaro support.
I like the ease of using it on different platforms. I don’t like the misleading offers stating +60% offfrom renewing price, and instead paying the same price as the first time.

Don't like: login seems complicated - seems they want you to pay extra to make it simpler. Keeps logging out. Been taking a while to connect. Also they kept 'pestering emails' to write a review ! Unneccessary! When it does connect the VPN works ok.

Review.Titre: Almost unable to use in china
Review.Contenu: If someone would to travel to china and choose vpn provider, please don't consider nordvpn, because their services was almost unable to use in china.Some specific looks like from my was use experience: 1.can't login account directly in china (reason: any login api endpoint was blocked in china) 2.can't connect to vpn in china without obfuscation protocol (reason: chinese government highly to block standard protocol vpn) 3. almost unable to use with obfuscation server (reason: looks no asia optimized server)

Review.Titre: I like that I can watch series from over the world…

On many occasions could not connect with some Asian countriesStupid to ask for several dates over some weeks of "Police interrogation"I'm just going to insert any date

Review.Contenu: It does provide anonymity, but at a cost of lag and other issues.  I have found that running the VPN slows things a good deal, there is a lot of lag and buffer time, causes a host of other issues with the opperating system including printing, programs not working correctly, and the inability to access certain websites.

Review.Titre: For some reason that I don't…
Review.Contenu: For some reason that I don't understand, some applications (such as MYTIM telephone operator) do not work if NordVPN is connected, to make them work I have to disconnect itBest regardRoberto

Generally the Nord App works well and compared to Apple Keychain the Passwords and Logins are easier to access and maintain, particularly useful for phone app logins.  Downside is the Nord App needs to be open before going to a website login, and it often needs re-linking to Safari - or you get a message telling you to open Nordpass when it is already open.

Review.Titre: Connection to slow for tv and streaming…
Review.Contenu: Connection to slow for tv and streaming at times. I have internet via fiber 250/250 but when using the VPN connection it is not enough.
Hi. Overall good service, needs following attention:1. Slow start up?2. System requires too much of download speed, approximately 50 to 60% most times?
I love the safety features and options however the background power consumption on iOS platform is excessive and the problem has persisted for over a year now

Review.Titre: Works well on the PC computer
Review.Contenu: Works well on the PC computer. Not so much on the IPhone and IPad. Often, I can not access Internet because NordVPN is bugged and needs to be closed and reiniatlized.

Good is that you can change the vpn country very fast.Also there is minimum lag in Kbps.The worldmap is okay.Less good is that Nord makes the startup op the pc. longer and is kicked out a number of times on my Androïd phone.Also I don't like to sign in, when I start the VPN from scratch. Gives me the feeling that I'm not anonymous.There is a bug that, if I physically disconnect from the internet (take the UTP cable off the router) and put the screens on energysaving (win 10), the pc-screens start to flicker on and off and I have to restart my pc to get that in order.More and more sites recognize that I connect with a VPN.
I get many occasions when I can not access websites when NORD VPN is activated. Turn it off and the same site is accessible.

Nord used to have people we could talk to on their phone lines. Now they don't take phone calls.Who wants to type every word for technical support conversations? I surely dont!Nord used to take PayPal which helped with anonymous payments. Now they don't. Their old user api interface was much more user-friendly than it is now.It feels like it was sold and new owners want it their way instead of what it was when I joined them years ago. It felt like a safer service also.The new interface is dropping connections and turning off my settings that I have to keep reconfiguring. The new interface takes a very long time to connect to server at times. Old interface was much faster. Saving favorite servers was easier too.I kept the old interface for years and just recently thought I had to update it. I wish I hadnt!I tell my firewall to not allow some new connections from the new interface. One being an update service.Otherwise, it seems OK for my only experience with a VPN service and I do recommend them still.
Great protection, even blocks some web sites I need, slows internet connection to about 1/3 my high speed fiber connection.

Love the VPN, works great, great options. I wish they did not remove the three year term.i found it was a better deal. I am a loyal customer, but I almost switched because I was not offered a better deal. We shall see what happens next year.

Review.Titre: Login address blocked without notification or explanation
Review.Contenu: NordVPN specifically blocked my login e-mail address without any notice, warning or explanation. I have 3 devices still logged in and functioning, but I can't log in on any other device or even my Nord VPN account online. I did extensive testing and determined that they did indeed specifically block my registered address, not just any part of it or some word in it.I am still able to use Nord VPN on the devices that are already logged in, but not any other.I contacted support about why they blocked me and why the app and website are lying that the address is invalid. My rating can go either way up or down depending on the response I get. Wasted too much time on this already.

Update 7/11 - Nord did refund me following this review so have updated from 1 to 3 stars as happy I got my money back and as far as VPNs go the product is good...I still think taking payment for a subscription 2 weeks before renewal, and the way their customer service handled refund request prior to my review here was unacceptable though, and wouldn't recommend them.Initial Review...What's exactly is the point of the renewal date if you take the payment weeks before the renewal is due.I've been charged £130 that I cant afford to pay weeks ahead of my renewal date.I've paid all this money for a subscription that's not even due to start for another 2 weeks and you're completely refusing a refund of even a reduction in payment, when your advertising new users can subscribe for a fraction of the cost.As far as predatory subscriptions go, this is one of the worst I've seen.So as melodramatic as it sounds, I'm now out a £130 in the middle of a cost of living crisis with 2 small kids I'm now going to have to go into even more debt to feed them.Thanks NordVPN - I'll never use your service again!

Use to be absolutely seamless, it would reliably be up for months on end. Now it drops out all the time, so you have to constantly check you’re protected and logging on can be a headache.

Review.Contenu: There are quite a few moments that I cannot reach the website I'm looking for so that I have to switch off the VPN to accomplish my goals.

It took explaining multiple times in multiple ways, but we mostly got there. I have used NordVPN since the beta days (3-year plans for cheappp), and reach out to support prior to renewal for better grandfathered rates. I get the newest best rate each time, but this rate gets higher with each renewal. I wish the process was a bit easier with support, and also if I were to keep my original rate and time period for my continued loyalty to the brand.

Generally reliable, reasonably priced VPN with locations all over the world.  I feel safe with NordVPN.If anyone there is listening, two features I'd like are:1) the ability to say Use this location no matter where I am, unless I tell you differently.  (e.g., I'd always like to connect to Chicago no matter where I am).2) provide better info when the Wi-Fi server is not connected to the internet.  At present, Nord just looks like it is endlessly, unsuccessfully trying to connect.

One of the most popular and efficient VPNs at an affordable price.  I've been using it for a couple of years and I'm very satisfied with it.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I use Linux and for this OS.  the possibility of carrying out and storing tunneling for specific sites (which have problems with VPN) is missing.
My first experience with VPN.Hard to evaluate do to this fact.So far, looks like it has kept us safe.Had to turn off temporarily many time in order to use about 40% of websites needed.

Review.Titre: We use Nord NPN while traveling abroad
Review.Contenu: We use Nord NPN while traveling abroad.  We spent several months traveling Europe and were very impressed by Nord's performance.  It is easy to use and it is very reassuring knowing that we can safely connect to the internet in any country we visited.
Ease of use, Only grump is renewal twice price for original sign up which I will review before end of contract next year.

Review.Titre: It works very well and is reliable
Review.Contenu: It works very well and is reliable. The only issue is it gets confused after a number of sleep cycles and requires a disconnect and re-connect. Nothing serious.

Review.Titre: VPN knocks out for no reason very frequently
Review.Contenu: Everything is great. Have issues with the VPN knocking out for no reason. Wondering why it is happening as everything is working fine.

4/5 for connecting speeds. 3/5 for city or country. The one I use when it’s busy is redirecting to USA and this is not the country of choice. Never. Everything else is 5/5. I would highly recommend as this is great for mobile and home.

Review.Titre: Affordable and somewhat easy to use
Review.Contenu: I give this product 4 out of 5, itz a great affordable VPN. The only downside is I have to re-sub every month because there is no auto renewal. That is the only problem I have with this product.  Also, an added malware removal tool  would be awesome.

I use the linux version of Nord VPN. Everything can be done, but has to be done through the terminal, there is no GUI. There was an opensource project, but I think it is no longer developed. I've found the servers to be very fast I can not see speed difference when compaired to direct connection. Mostly I use Nord VPN when I'm on a customer site and they block various sites or ports. This VPN usually allows me access through their firewall. If the NordLynx doesn't work then the OpenVPN will or vice versa.

Great response time, and step by step advice! Extremely professional and friendly service! The only thing I would improve is maybe in addition to email support, perhaps a live chat box or phone number for support in case it’s urgent. Nonetheless a great experience thanks again!

Nordvpn's Open VPN just works fine in heavy restricted countries like Iran and UAE but Nordlynx protocol not working at all, so sad. Fine for streaming and security features are more than enough for a VPN.
Easy to flip between Countries to find strongest signal strength, in particular for streaming type content

Review.Titre: Does what it says in the tin
Review.Contenu: Does what it says in the tin. Easy to use and intuitive deselecting for sites that won’t play with a VPN. Very fast and cheaper than main competitor whom I found a bit sniffy when I complained about sites not working with their VPN.

Review.Titre: A number of useful features in addition…
Review.Contenu: A number of useful features in addition to the VPN. I use Nord but I also have Surfshark and sometimes switch to it because Nord can get annoying when it isn't https. It warns you it isn't https then you have to click allow connection but sometimes it still won't connect. It also can stop a lot of commercial sites from loading and such. The speed on Nord is generally faster. The other annoyance is that it will sometimes take forever to connect or it just won't do it at all and have to reboot. Meshnet is a handy feature that allows large file transfers between linked devices but can be hard to figure out. In comparison Surfshark has fewer extra features but doesn't cause the same connection problems and is somewhat slower.

Review.Titre: Connections to NordVPN are not slow but…
Review.Contenu: Connections to NordVPN are not slow but neither are they as quick as I would reasonably like. Apart from this speed aspect, the service performs well.

Review.Titre: The app works fine but I found that…
Review.Contenu: The app works fine but I found that there is a distinct lag in response in Nord vpn from Express vpn.

Review.Titre: Great for product, poor for ongoing pricing
Review.Contenu: I have been using NordVPN for a number of years now - great product, never had an issue using it, doesnt seem to be too bloated so it loads okay.My issue is that when I went to take advantage of the Black Friday sale price, as my renewal was in a week or so, I was given the full price option. For the last 2 or 3 years I have had to pay full price and the options to get a deal are not at a convenient time, so I never take advantage of them.Nice price to suck you in, then full price for ever to use their product. But the product is good, just dont know if it is that good and worth the price paid.

Review.Titre: Very good VPN most of the time
Review.Contenu: Very good VPN most of the time, but it has a few recurring problems:1. Disconnects from iPhone, iPad & MacBook Pro while running and VPN profile gets deleted, requiring sign-in to reconnect on many iOS versions. Nord was unable to find a solution. Leaves devices unprotected during these times.2. Can take several minutes to connect on MacBook Pro. Must reboot at times to connect.3. Even though Nord is set to auto connect, all devices connect to many services before Nord sets up an encrypted connection.
Easy setup, fast logins and seems very reliable.

Review.Titre: It’s a good service, but needs to keep up with platforms
Review.Contenu: It’s a good service. Useful in many situations. For their size however I can’t believe they don’t have a native app for Apple TV unlike their competitors.
I feel protected.Frequently I have connection problems when using my computer. They usually resolve themselves, but it can be annoying.I wouldn't serf the net without it.
Pretty good vpn service. American living in Thailand. I use it for security, and access to my region-restricted apps. 9/10, no real complaints

Everything great but I do have a problem with my Internet provider as I have a microwave link to their Network access point, which means with bad weather, severe wind or their own maintenance problems, I lose the service. Hence the 4stars! Overall Nord Service GREAT!!!

Fastest VPN used to date, up against Express and Surfshark (would not recommend either as have had sketchy dealings with both their billing department). Very good for online gaming speeds. Wish it could block ads better on mobile. Example, Surfshark blocked Pandora commercial ads very well.Nord seems to hang periodically and has trouble reconnecting on a known and stable network. Sometimes it will self correct and prompt to switch protocols, sometime it requires a mobile restart.

Overall a good product. It would get 5 stars if not for the following issues:* Login sequence is clumsy. * If the last used server is unavailable, the app does not automatically keep searching for another one. It just does not connect and the user must select a server and try again. If you do not realize that the auto-connect has failed, then the session is unprotected. * Each user on a Mac computer must have and maintain a separate instantiation of the app.

Review.Titre: Decent VPN but with some Caveats

This review form doesn't permit long term use, and I've been using NORD for an extended period of time.

Review.Titre: Nord is the best on the market.
Review.Contenu: It's extremely consistent on my cell phone. It's about the same for my computer.

I'm using NordVPN since April 2022 and all the time I had an excellent VPN connection in all devices (primarily computers and smartphones), almost without any service interruption. I like the number of available servers as well as the connection speed.

NordVPN works generally fine on all of my devices. It slows down the internet connection, however. Also, it works better on newer (windows 11) devices, than on older (windows 10) ones. Connection time from remote areas/continents is long.

Review.Titre: Very good but still room for improvement
Review.Contenu: While Nord is very good, there are some occasions where it does not start up automatically as I think it should. One is after an iPadOS update.
